prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Hello madam. I have a horary chart that I would like to have you interpret but first I need to know what house to use to represent the person that is being asked about.

 Suzanne is the wife of a friend of mine, Stefan.  Typically, when I do a chart for Stephan, I have him represented by the 9th house as a foreign connection -  He lives in Munich, Germany.  However, I don't have any established relationship or connection with Suzanne. So I'm not exactly sure what house to place her in to represent her.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes: Melissa, in traditional horary practice a spouse or partner is typically indicated by the seventh house regardless of other associations. Since Stefan is marked by the ninth house for his foreign connection, his wife—being only connected through him rather than by a personal link with you—is best represented by the seventh house in your chart.
swipes: Melissa, in traditional horary practice a spouse or partner is typically indicated by the seventh house regardless of other associations. Since Stefan is marked by the ninth house for his foreign connection, his wife—being only connected through him rather than by a personal link with you—is best represented by the seventh house in your chart.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Alright then, I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What kind of person is Suzanne, how does she approach romantic and committed partnerships, what is her nature in this regard?

Please proceed to reference Suzanne as you have indicated.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is the compiled list of relevant chart data derived strictly from horary principles for Suzanne’s inquiry:

• Chart Structure & Configuration:
 – Chart Shape: Bowl shape
 – Dominant Element of Inner Planets: Air
 – Dominant Mode Among Inner Planets: Fixed
 – Quadrant Distribution: Most planets in the top left; bottom right quadrant is empty
 – Moon Phase: Waxing Crescent

• Ascendant & Houses:
 – Ascendant: 24°59′ Gemini
 – 7th House (Suzanne’s significator for partnerships): Cusp at 24° Sagittarius (no natal planets present in the 7th, but its condition is influenced by aspects elsewhere)
 – Other House Positions:
  – 2nd House: Begins at 14° Cancer (contains Mars)
  – 3rd House: Begins at 5° Leo
  – 4th House: Begins at 29° Leo
  – 5th House: Begins at 1° Libra
  – 6th House: Begins at 13° Scorpio
  – 8th House: Begins at 14° Capricorn (contains Pluto)
  – 9th House: Begins at 5° Aquarius (contains Sun and Mercury)
  – 10th House: Begins at 29° Aquarius (contains Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node)
  – 11th House: Begins at 1° Aries (contains Moon and Chiron)
  – 12th House: Begins at 13° Taurus (contains Jupiter and Uranus)

• Planetary Positions:
 – Sun: 16°12′ Aquarius
 – Moon: 8°53′ Taurus
 – Mercury: 12°45′ Aquarius
 – Venus: 0°19′ Aries
 – Mars: 19°25′ Cancer (retrograde)
 – Jupiter: 11°16′ Gemini
 – Saturn: 17°50′ Pisces
 – Uranus: 23°16′ Taurus
 – Neptune: 28°04′ Pisces
 – Pluto: 2°10′ Aquarius
 – North Node: 29°39′ Pisces (retrograde)
 – Chiron: 19°37′ Aries

• Major Aspects (with provided orbs):
 – Mars square Chiron (0° orb)
 – Neptune conjunction North Node (1° orb)
 – Venus conjunction North Node (1° orb)
 – Mercury trine Jupiter (1° orb)
 – Venus sextile Pluto (2° orb)
 – Venus conjunction Neptune (2° orb)
 – Mars trine Saturn (2° orb)
 – Pluto sextile North Node (3° orb)
 – Sun sextile Chiron (3° orb)
 – Mars sextile Uranus (4° orb)
 – Neptune square Ascendant (4° orb)
 – Moon square Mercury (4° orb)
 – Sun conjunction Mercury (4° orb)
 – Chiron sextile Ascendant (5° orb)
 – Uranus sextile Neptune (5° orb)
 – Ascendant trine MC (5° orb)
 – Sun trine Jupiter (5° orb)
 – Saturn sextile Uranus (6° orb)
 – Uranus square MC (6° orb)
 – Jupiter square Saturn (6° orb)
 – Venus square Ascendant (6° orb)
 – Moon square Pluto (6° orb)
 – Saturn square Ascendant (7° orb)
 – Sun square Uranus (7° orb)
 – Sun trine Ascendant (8° orb)

• Patterns & Special Features:
 – Multiple Planet Square: Involving Neptune (28° Pisces), Ascendant (24° Gemini), Saturn (17° Pisces), Jupiter (11° Gemini), and Venus (0° Aries)
 – Frequency: Square aspects occur nine times; Sun is in ten aspects
 – Rulership: Neptune in Pisces is in the sign of its rulership
 – Jupiter’s Position: Jupiter is noted with rising prominence in its sign association

These details form the factual basis for a methodical horary analysis of Suzanne, her intrinsic nature regarding romantic and committed partnerships, and the dynamics involved.

• Patterns & Special Features:

 – Frequency: Square aspects occur nine times; Sun is in ten aspects
 – Rulership: Neptune in Pisces is in the sign of its rulership
 – Jupiter’s Position: Jupiter is noted with rising prominence in its sign association

These details form the factual basis for a methodical horary analysis of Suzanne, her intrinsic nature regarding romantic and committed partnerships, and the dynamics involved.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart for Suzanne reveals a personality that fuses progressive intellect with a yearning for soulful connection in romance. The core themes emerging include the following:

1. Suzanne’s underlying approach to partnerships derives partly from the idealistic and almost mystical conjunction between Venus and Neptune in the 10th house. This marks her as drawn to romance that is elevated by inspiration and an inherent longing for deep, transpersonal union—even if that can sometimes lead to disillusionment when reality falls short of her lofty expectations.

2. The influence of Aquarius—evident through the Sun and Mercury in Aquarius in the 9th house—imbues her with a forward-thinking, unconventional mindset. She tends to approach relationships with an intellectual detachment, valuing communication, freedom, and progressive ideals over traditional constraints.

3. The 7th house, signifying committed partnerships, is ruled by Sagittarius. While it is not heavily occupied by personal planets, its condition is influenced by aspects elsewhere. This suggests that Suzanne’s search for connection is less about conventional marital roles and more about finding a partner who shares her philosophical or adventurous pursuits.

4. A challenging square between Mars (in Cancer in the 2nd house) and Chiron signals potential past wounds influencing how she asserts herself in love. This aspect implies that when emotional security is threatened, she may become defensive or experience inner pain—hindering the ease with which she can fully express her desirous self.

5. The overall configuration—a bowl shape with a dominant fixed air influence for the inner planets—indicates that once Suzanne forms convictions about love, she clings firmly to them. This solidity of belief, combined with her idealism, makes her simultaneously magnetic and occasionally obstinate in matters of the heart.

6. The interplay of additional square aspects throughout the chart points to an ongoing tension between her ideals and the practicalities of love. Suzanne is likely to oscillate between craving unbridled, transcendent passion and a need for intellectual clarity and independence.

Based on these factors, Suzanne is seen as someone who values a relationship that transcends the ordinary, one that melds mental stimulation with a search for a higher, almost spiritual kind of intimacy. Yet beneath these aspirations lies the potential for vulnerability when deep-seated insecurities arise, challenging the balance between desire and self-protection.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Chart Details: What kind of person is Suzanne, how does she approach romantic and committed partnerships, what is her nature in this regard?
Birthday: Feb. 4, 2025, 1:39 PM
Suzanne represented: 7th house
swipes:
Chart Details: What kind of person is Suzanne, how does she approach romantic and committed partnerships, what is her nature in this regard?
Birthday: Feb. 4, 2025, 1:39 PM
Suzanne represented: 7th house

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Can you explain this a little more clearly with better detail? I'm not exactly sure I understand.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusting her ornate shawl and leaning forward with piercing eyes Let me be more direct about what I see in Suzanne's chart, my dear.

The Venus-Neptune conjunction in her 10th house shows a woman who lives in fantasy when it comes to love. She likely builds elaborate romantic scenarios in her mind, dreaming of the perfect soul connection. But this same aspect suggests she may struggle with seeing partners clearly – she's prone to putting them on pedestals, only to feel crushed when they show human flaws.

Her Mars in Cancer, retrograde in the 2nd house, reveals deep-seated insecurities about intimacy. When hurt, she retreats like a crab into its shell. The square to Chiron suggests past romantic wounds that still ache – perhaps betrayal or abandonment that makes her hesitant to fully trust.

gesturing emphatically at the chart

The Sagittarius 7th house tells me she needs intellectual stimulation and adventure in partnership. A boring, conventional relationship would suffocate her. She's drawn to partners who can engage her mind and challenge her perspectives. Yet that same Sagittarian influence makes her restless – she may struggle with commitment if she feels trapped.

The fixed air dominance shows someone who, once her mind is made up about a person or situation, is extremely difficult to sway. She can be stubborn to a fault, especially about her ideals regarding love and partnership.

tapping the chart meaningfully

Most tellingly, the multiple squares in her chart point to inner conflicts: She desperately wants deep intimacy but fears being hurt. She craves security but chafes at restriction. She seeks the perfect soul union but may sabotage real connections by comparing them to her fantasies.

In essence, Suzanne approaches relationships with a complex mix of yearning and fear, idealism and doubt. She needs a partner who can be patient with her contradictions while challenging her to grow beyond them.

Does this clarify what you're seeing in her nature, my dear?

mes: Well, I guess I'm trying to understand what would make her openly berate her husband in public. especially being that they are both natives of Munich, Germany and live there as of right now.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
eyes narrowing as she reshuffles the cards with practiced grace Ah, now we get to the heart of the matter. Let me look deeper into these aspects,

spreading her hands over the chart

The Mars retrograde in Cancer square Chiron is particularly telling here. This isn't just about insecurity – it's about public humiliation as a weapon. When Mars moves backward in Cancer, it often manifests as passive-aggressive behavior that eventually erupts into public displays of anger. The square to Chiron suggests she's acting out her own wounds by inflicting them on others.

The Venus-Neptune conjunction in the 10th house of public image shows someone who may feel a deep sense of disappointment with her public role or status. She likely feels deceived about something in her marriage, and rather than address it privately, she's chosen to make it a public spectacle.

tapping the chart emphatically

Most crucially, the Saturn square Jupiter aspect suggests a fundamental conflict between her expectations of marriage (Jupiter) and the reality of her responsibilities (Saturn). Being natives of Munich adds another layer – there's likely cultural pressure about proper behavior that she's deliberately flouting.

The multiple planet square pattern involving Venus shows she's acting out of profound frustration with her role as a wife. She's not just angry – she's trying to shatter an image or reputation. The question is: what triggered this behavior?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
tracing the aspects with her bejeweled finger Ah yes, now I see the trigger points quite clearly,

The Mars retrograde in Cancer in the 2nd house forms a telling pattern. This suggests issues around money and resources. More specifically, there are indications of hidden financial dealings or secret accounts. The square to Chiron implies this discovery caused deep personal wounding.

gesturing to the planetary alignments

Venus conjunct Neptune in the 10th house, when read with these other aspects, points to deception around social status or public image. She likely discovered her husband was presenting a false front to their social circle. This could involve anything from financial fraud to,  pauses meaningfully , intimate betrayals.

The Saturn-Jupiter square adds tension around moral and ethical boundaries. Given Jupiter's placement in Gemini, there may be evidence of double-dealing or two-faced behavior. Communications or messages may have been discovered.

leaning forward intently

Most critically, Pluto in the 8th house - the house of other people's resources, sexuality, and secrets - suggests she uncovered something deeply hidden that involves joint assets or intimate betrayals. The aspects to Venus and the North Node hint at karmic revelations coming to light.

Her public outbursts appear to be retaliation for discovering these deceptions. She's choosing to shatter his carefully maintained public image just as her own illusions were shattered.

Would you like me to examine the timing of when these discoveries likely occurred?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Very well, let us delve further into the triggers that might prompt Suzanne to publicly berate her husband.

First, note the potent Mars in Cancer retrograde. In this placement, Mars doesn’t express its energy openly but rather turns inward, nurturing unresolved pains. Its square to Chiron in Aries intensifies this effect—it suggests that deep, perhaps long-held wounds are being reactivated. Mars in Cancer often indicates that emotional security is paramount, and when that security is threatened or feels compromised, the response can be indirect yet forceful—manifesting as a public outburst. In Suzanne’s case, it may be that a trigger perceived as emotional betrayal or abandonment stokes this reactive anger.

Second, the Venus-Neptune conjunction in the 10th house of public image and reputation introduces a layer of idealism and disillusionment. This aspect can blur boundaries between reality and fantasy in matters of love. Should reality fall short of the grand expectations she has woven in her inner world, the disappointment can emerge with a sting, particularly when her public status or self-image is implicated. The pressure of meeting culturally set expectations—especially being native to Munich where social decorum is keenly observed—may cause internal conflict that explodes in the public arena.

Additionally, consider the Saturn-Jupiter tension, especially as it plays out against the backdrop of her domestic structure. Jupiter's influence points to high expectations in the realm of partnership, while Saturn imposes the cold realities of responsibility and limitation. This tension, when unresolved, can create a simmering sense of injustice or pressure. When these contrasting energies collide, the resulting frustration can produce outbursts intended to rebuke perceived shortcomings in her marital relationship.

Collectively, the configuration of these aspects suggests that Suzanne’s public berating of her husband is not impulsive but the culmination of clashing internal ideals and unaddressed emotional pain. The chart indicates a scenario where a specific provocative incident—whether a perceived betrayal or an unmet expectation—serves as the spark to ignite this long-held internal conflict. The subsequent public expression becomes a means to reclaim a sense of identity and voice, albeit in a manner that disrupts the shared private sphere.

Based on the chart, the indications are clear: suppressed emotional pain (Mars retrograde and its square to Chiron), unmet high ideals (Venus-Neptune in the public sphere), and a clash between expansive expectations and practical limitations (Saturn-Jupiter tension) converge to produce a critical trigger. This combination can very well lead Suzanne to vent her frustrations openly, seeking to alter perceptions and reclaim emotional control in a way that is both cathartic and shocking in the eyes of others.

This analysis is strictly derived from the horary elements presented. Further details in the context of her life and relationship dynamics would be needed for a more comprehensive reading.
